Description:
ServiceRequest.Read allows a client to look up ServiceRequest details by providing a specific ServiceRequest ID. The ID is typically returned as part of the response of a different FHIR resource request.

This resource returns a non-medication order for a patient, such as a procedure, culture, ECG, EKG, imaging, lab, micro, or radiology order.

Note: The STU3 version of this API is called ProcedureRequest.

ServiceRequest.Name: ServiceRequest
ServiceRequest.Description: An instance of the R4 ServiceRequest resource.

asNeededBoolean.Name: asNeededBoolean
asNeededBoolean.Description: If set to true, indicates that the order is only performed when needed within the specified schedule.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The order instant. This is the date and time when the status is not draft or unknown.

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description:
Reference to one or more of the following:

  • A ServiceRequest resource corresponding to the parent order. Included if the order is a child order.
  • A CarePlan resource corresponding to the treatment plan or therapy plan from which the procedure was ordered. Included if the order was placed from a treatment plan or therapy plan.
  • A ServiceRequest resource corresponding to the order template. Included if the order is from a treatment or therapy plan. This type of reference is available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic or starting in the May 2021 special update.

code.Name: code
code.Description: External codings for procedures linked to the order. The API returns all possible codings (SNOMED, CPT, LOINC, CBV, THL, Kuntalitto) associated with the Procedure/Service in Epic.

doNotPerform.Name: doNotPerform
doNotPerform.Description: This is set to true if the status is draft, revoked, or unknown.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to the encounter resource in which the ServiceRequest was placed.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The system-specific identifier for the ServiceRequest resource.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description:
The intent code. Epic supported values include:

  • filler-order
  • order
  • original-order
  • plan
  • proposal

is-scannable-encounter.Name: extension
is-scannable-encounter.Description: If true, this order or procedure is scannable.

occurrenceTiming.Name: occurrenceTiming
occurrenceTiming.Description: This event element is populated for auto-released orders.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The frequency name and description. This element can be configured to use a custom mapping configuration completed by the Epic organization. This item will return the interval for Outpatient procedures orders.

event.Name: event
event.Description: The event element is populated for auto-released orders. Includes an array of the times that each occurrence of the order (i.e. child order) was released.

boundsPeriod.Name: boundsPeriod
boundsPeriod.Description: Includes a start and an end element that hold the start and end times for the order.

count.Name: count
count.Description: The number of occurrences of the order (i.e. child orders).

countMax.Name: countMax
countMax.Description: The maximum number of occurrences of the order for a PRN order.

frequency.Name: frequency
frequency.Description: How many times the order occurs in the given period.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The period of time used to define the cycle length of a frequency. For example, an order that occurs once every 6 hours has a period of 6 hours.

periodUnit.Name: periodUnit
periodUnit.Description: The time unit for the period.

when.Name: when
when.Description: The time of day the occurrence happens.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description: The priority. The value returned here depends on custom mapping configuration completed by the Epic organization.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: The standard terminology codes mapped to the procedure, which can include LOINC, SNOMED, CPT, CBV, THL, or Kuntalitto codes.

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: Who or what is requesting the service. Reference to a Practitioner resource.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the request. Supported values include:

  • draft
  • active
  • completed
  • revoked
  • unknown

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to a patient resource for whom the ServiceRequest was made.
